description: Comprehensive current state assessment and process discovery across Asset Management, Investor Relations, Operations, and Operating Experts functions.

documentation.sharepointPath: /General/Offerings & Projects/2. Process Discovery & Strategy/Metropolitan - Current State Assessment/Working Files/Phase 1 - Current State Assessment/Process Discovery/Discovery Sessions/!Documentation/!Working Files_Nikoleta/1. Documentation/0. Summary Sections/Current State Overview_V01.docx
documentation.extractedText:
Current State Overview

Current State Overview	1
Organizational Structure	2
Key Systems and Tools	2
Existing Data Infrastructure	2
Interdepartmental dependencies	2

 
Organizational Structure
Overview
Metropolitan’s organizational structure is designed for strategic leadership, investment execution, and operational efficiency. The firm operates through four primary divisions:
	•	Senior Management – Provides overall governance, risk oversight, and firm-wide leadership.
	•	Investment Management – Responsible for deal sourcing, underwriting, and asset management.
	•	Business Management – Oversees finance, investor relations, legal, and operations.
	•	Investment Committee – Exercises final investment decision-making authority.
With 31 professionals as of December 2024, Metropolitan maintains a highly specialized and disciplined team, ensuring robust investment strategy execution.

Senior Management
The Senior Management team is responsible for corporate governance, compliance, and strategic oversight.
Key Executives
	•	Paul Lisiak – Managing Partner, Chief Investment Officer (CIO) | 26 years of experience | University of Pennsylvania
	•	Julian Weldon – General Counsel, Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) | 27+ years of experience | University of East Anglia
	•	Stephen Faughnan – Managing Director | 26+ years of experience | Pace University, NYU Stern
Primary Responsibilities
✔ Investment Strategy & Execution
✔ Legal & Compliance Oversight
✔ Firm-wide Governance & Risk Management
Senior Management provides firm-wide leadership while ensuring regulatory compliance and risk mitigation.

Investment Committee
The Investment Committee (IC) is responsible for final investment approvals, portfolio oversight, and risk assessment.
Committee Members
	•	Paul Lisiak – Managing Partner, CIO
	•	Adrian Blumfield – IC Member | 30+ years of experience | University of Cambridge, London Business School
	•	Fred Ganning – IC Member | 30+ years of experience | Seton Hall University
Core Functions
✔ Final Investment Decision-Making
✔ Risk & Portfolio Management
✔ Fund Strategy & Capital Allocation
The IC ensures disciplined investment selection, risk mitigation, and adherence to the firm’s strategic objectives.

Investment Management
The Investment Management team is responsible for deal origination, underwriting, and active asset management.
Investment Sourcing & Underwriting
Handles deal origination, due diligence, and underwriting.
Leadership
	•	George Alifragis – Head of Operating Expert Network
	•	Richard Lin – Managing Director
Team Structure
✔ Vice Presidents & Principals – Lead investment sourcing and execution.
✔ Associates & Analysts – Support financial modeling, due diligence, and execution.
✔ 500+ Operating Expert Network – Provides specialized industry insights.
Asset Management
Responsible for post-investment oversight, loan servicing, and portfolio monitoring.
Leadership
	•	Alex Verba – Managing Director
Team Composition
✔ Vice Presidents & Associates – Oversee borrower relationships, financial monitoring, and performance optimization.
Total Investment Management Team: 14 Professionals

Business Management
The Business Management division oversees finance, investor relations, operations, and legal compliance.
Finance & Accounting
Responsible for financial reporting, fund accounting, and audit coordination.
	•	Douglas Gold – Chief Accounting Officer & Senior Vice President
	•	Team: Vice Presidents, Controllers, Fund Accountants.
Investment Operations & Reporting
Manages data analytics, investment performance reporting, and internal controls.
	•	Jason Bircann – Vice President
	•	Team: Senior Operations Associates & Analysts.
Investor Relations
Handles LP communications, fundraising support, and investor reporting.
	•	Scarly Almonte – Senior Associate
Firm Operations
Ensures legal compliance, administrative efficiency, and corporate governance.
	•	Kevin O’Block & Megan Krishnamurthy – Vice Presidents, Office of the CIO
	•	Benjamin Bertan – Associate General Counsel
Total Business Management Team: 14 Professionals
Key Systems and Tools – TO BE ADDED
Existing Data Infrastructure – TO BE ADDED
Interdepartmental Dependencies

Network graph -Report/Deliverable with Data Sources and Data Source Owner

As visible in the network graphs, Metropolitan leverages multiple data sources to produce the majority of its deliverables. While this approach allows for the incorporation of diverse and detailed inputs, it inherently demands significant coordination and effort across various teams. This reliance on cross-functional collaboration introduces challenges, particularly when team availability is constrained, leading to inefficiencies, delays, and bottlenecks in the process. The time and resources required to synchronize efforts across departments highlight an opportunity to optimize workflows.
Compounding these challenges, several reports require insights and input from Asset Managers and Deal Team members, which are often not formally docu

Interdepartmental Dependencies
Workstream Dependencies
Overview
Effective collaboration across departments is essential to ensuring seamless operations, regulatory compliance, and data integrity. Each functional team plays a critical role in the broader ecosystem, contributing to portfolio oversight, financial accuracy, deal execution, and investor communications. This document consolidates the key interdepartmental dependencies, illustrating how various teams work together to drive efficiency and maintain strategic alignment.
Key Interdepartmental Dependencies – MISSING COCD, OE
	•	Asset Management Team 
	•	Serves as the primary collaborator, managing the debt portfolio and ensuring efficient handling of related activities.
	•	Works with Legal on deal amendments, regulatory compliance, and c

High consultant costs relative to revenue suggest possible scope expansion or pricing issue
